abstract.p: Dr Dina D Strachan letter on Aug 29 article notes malignant melanoma does occur in people of color

block.p: The column ''Yet Another Reminder: Forget the Suntan'' on Aug. 29 mentions that malignant melanoma occurs more commonly in fair-skinned people. This form of skin cancer is, indeed, much more common in this population, but as a dermatologist who has cared for a number of nonwhite patients who presented with metastatic disease, I believe that it is important to mention that malignant melanoma does occur in people of color.

The column ''Yet Another Reminder: Forget the Suntan'' on Aug. 29 mentions that malignant melanoma occurs more commonly in fair-skinned people. This form of skin cancer is, indeed, much more common in this population, but as a dermatologist who has cared for a number of nonwhite patients who presented with metastatic disease, I believe that it is important to mention that malignant melanoma does occur in people of color.

In dark-skinned people, malignant melanoma more often presents on the palms and soles or the fingernails and toenails. When it presents on these areas, melanoma tends to have a worse prognosis. It is not always associated with a history of sunburn. Dark-skinned persons should also be aware of the dangers of malignant melanoma.
DR. DINA D. STRACHAN New York
